intro: Nitrosalsola dendroides, commonly known as the tree spurge, is a shrub-like plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in clusters. The plant has smooth, often reddish bark and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. It is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system for water absorption. Nitrosalsola dendroides is often found in rocky areas and is known for its resilience to drought.
